skill.name: agent-creator
skill.description: Creates specialized AI agents with optimized system prompts using the official 4-phase SOP methodology from Desktop .claude-flow, combined with evidence-based prompting techniques and Claude Agent SDK implementation. Use this skill when creating production-ready agents for specific domains, workflows, or tasks requiring consistent high-quality performance with deeply embedded domain knowledge.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing markdown documentation and Graphviz diagram. No executable code, no network calls, no file system access, no command execution. Behavior matches stated purpose exactly.

content.user_title: Create specialized AI agents with SOP methodology
content.value_statement: Creating AI agents from scratch is complex and inconsistent. This skill provides a proven 4-phase methodology to build production-ready agents with deeply embedded domain knowledge, evidence-based prompting techniques, and Claude Agent SDK implementation.
actual_capabilities: Apply 4-phase SOP methodology for agent creation (analysis, extraction, architecture, enhancement)
Design system prompts with evidence-based techniques (self-consistency, program-of-thought, plan-and-solve)
Implement agents using Claude Agent SDK with TypeScript and Python
Create guardrails and failure mode prevention for agent behavior
Define MCP server integrations and multi-agent coordination patterns
Package agents with documentation, tests, and performance metrics
limitations: Does not execute code or access filesystem directly
Requires Claude Agent SDK installed for implementation
Does not generate actual agent code files (provides templates only)
User must have domain expertise to fill in technical patterns

use_cases.title: Build domain specialists
use_cases.description: Create agents with embedded expertise for specific domains like marketing, backend development, or data analysis

use_cases.title: Standardize agent creation
use_cases.description: Apply consistent methodology across team when building automation agents for CI/CD pipelines

use_cases.title: Design agent specifications
use_cases.description: Define agent requirements and behavior specifications using structured templates

prompt_templates.title: Simple Agent
prompt_templates.prompt: Use agent-creator to create a [role] agent for [task domain]. Include identity, core capabilities, and 2 example workflows.

prompt_templates.title: Full Methodology
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply full 4-phase SOP methodology to create a production-ready [role] agent. Include Phase 4 technical enhancement with code patterns.

prompt_templates.title: SDK Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement the [agent name] using Claude Agent SDK in [TypeScript|Python]. Include custom tools from Phase 4 and MCP server configuration.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Agent Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an orchestration agent using agent-creator that coordinates [agent-1] and [agent-2] for [workflow].

output_examples.input: Create a code review agent using the full 4-phase methodology
output: Phase 1: Domain Analysis - code review patterns, language-specific rules, security scanning
Phase 2: Expertise Extraction - bug detection heuristics, PR feedback guidelines
Phase 3: System Prompt - identity, 6 specialist commands, guardrails
Phase 4: Technical Enhancement - pattern library with file references, failure mode handbook
Claude Agent SDK implementation with custom tools

best_practices: Start with Phase 1 analysis even for familiar domains to document integration requirements
Include specific file paths and line numbers in Phase 4 code patterns for precision
Test agents with edge cases before deployment to validate guardrails
anti_patterns: Skipping Phase 1 analysis leads to agents with superficial domain knowledge
Using generic templates without domain-specific patterns reduces agent quality
Failing to document failure modes causes agents to repeat mistakes

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Claude Agent SDK implementation requires Claude Code environment.

faq.question: How long does agent creation take?
faq.answer: First-time creation takes 3.5-5.5 hours. Experienced creators using templates can complete in 2 hours.

faq.question: Can I integrate with existing MCP servers?
faq.answer: Yes. Phase 1 identifies required MCP servers. Phase 3 defines integration patterns. Phase 4 documents exact syntax.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This is a documentation-only skill. It does not access files, networks, or execute code. It generates templates for your review.

faq.question: Why is my agent producing inconsistent outputs?
faq.answer: Ensure Phase 2 extracted decision frameworks are embedded. Add self-consistency checks to Phase 3 guardrails. Test with Phase 7 validation suite.

faq.question: How does this compare to prompt-architect?
faq.answer: Agent-creator builds complete production agents. Prompt-architect optimizes individual prompts. Use both: prompt-architect refines system prompts created with agent-creator.
